newsitem.title: USA: U.S. jobless claims rose in latest week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. jobless claims rose in latest week.

text.p: U.S. Labor Department report of initial state jobless benefit claims, seasonally adjusted.
Week Ended Initial Claims 4-Week Avg. Continued Claims
R-Revised, Jan 18 Initial Claims from 355,000; Jan 18 4-Week Average from 353,750; and Jan 11 Continued Claims from 2,482,000 and Jan 4 from 2,580,000.
Wall Street economists had forecast initial jobless claims of 348,000 in the January 25 week.
The department said 29 states reported decreases in claims exceeding 1,000 on an unadjusted basis in the week ended January 18, the latest period for which data are available.
Among the largest were North Carolina, with 19,383; Tennessee, with 13,611; South Carolina, with 10,262; and Alabama, with 8,233.

North Carolina reported fewer layoffs in the construction, tobacco, textile, apparel, furniture, lumber, rubber and non-electrical machinery industries. Tennessee had fewer layoffs in a variety of industries.
South Carolina reported fewer layoffs in the food industry, while Alabama had fewer layoffs in the textile, apparel, furniture and lumber industries.
Labor said no states reported increases in initial claims exceeding 1,000, unadjusted, in the January 18 week.
